cluster_relations.rel_desc: Warm colors encourage or increase impulse purchases.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A causal or quasi-causal relation where the subject exerts a psychological or behavioral influence on the object, typically in consumer or branding contexts.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding

args.justification: All six relations describe the impact of color (or warm colors) on consumer perceptions and behaviors in branding and purchase contexts. They share the same causal, consumer-focused semantics, so a slightly more specific but still general predicate name 'influences_consumer_response' is clearer than the overly generic 'influences', while remaining compatible with the existing canonical description and relation class.
args.remark: Canonically renamed from 'influences' to 'influences_consumer_response' for greater specificity while preserving the same causal semantics in consumer psychology and behavior.

executed_decisions.justification: All six relations describe the impact of color (or warm colors) on consumer perceptions and behaviors in branding and purchase contexts. They share the same causal, consumer-focused semantics, so a slightly more specific but still general predicate name 'influences_consumer_response' is clearer than the overly generic 'influences', while remaining compatible with the existing canonical description and relation class.
executed_decisions.remark: Canonically renamed from 'influences' to 'influences_consumer_response' for greater specificity while preserving the same causal semantics in consumer psychology and behavior.
